name: Snake Plant
description: Tough, upright leaves that tolerate low light and infrequent watering. Great air purifier.

care.light: Low to bright indirect; tolerates some direct sun
care.water: Every 2-3 weeks; allow soil to dry completely
care.tips: Very forgiving if neglected; wipe leaves occasionally to remove dust

name: Spider Plant
description: Arching green-and-white striped leaves; produces baby plantlets. Easy to grow.

care.light: Bright indirect; avoids direct, hot sun
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist but not soggy
care.tips: Brown tips are usually caused by tap water; use distilled water or rainwater

name: Peace Lily
description: Glossy leaves and white spathes; thrives in low light and improves air quality.

care.light: Low to medium indirect; blooms best in brighter light
care.water: Weekly; water when leaves begin to droop dramatically
care.tips: Use distilled water to avoid brown leaf edges; sensitive to overwatering

name: ZZ Plant
description: Shiny, dark green leaves; drought-tolerant and nearly indestructible.

care.light: Low to bright indirect; avoid direct sun
care.water: Every 2-3 weeks; allow soil to dry completely between waterings
care.soil: Cactus or succulent mix for excellent drainage
care.tips: The plant stores water in its rhizomes, making it highly forgiving of neglect

name: Aloe Vera
description: Succulent with medicinal gel; needs bright light and minimal watering.

care.light: Bright direct sun; a south-facing window is ideal
care.water: Every 3 weeks; allow soil to fully dry out
care.tips: Ensure the pot has drainage holes; use gel from mature leaves for burns

name: Rubber Plant
description: Thick, glossy leaves; prefers bright, indirect light and moderate watering.

care.light: Bright indirect; more light encourages deeper color
care.water: Weekly; allow the top few inches of soil to dry out
care.tips: Wipe the large leaves frequently to keep them dust-free and shiny

name: Pothos
description: Trailing vine with heart-shaped leaves; thrives in low light and easy to propagate.

care.light: Low to bright indirect; lower light reduces variegation
care.water: Weekly; water when the top inch of soil is dry
care.soil: Standard potting mix; needs good drainage
care.tips: Prune to encourage fuller growth; easily propagated by placing cuttings in water

name: Heartleaf Philodendron
description: Lush, green foliage; adaptable and low-maintenance.

care.light: Medium to bright indirect; avoids direct sun
care.water: Weekly; allow the top half of the soil to dry
care.tips: Trailing varieties look great in hanging baskets; very tolerant of beginner mistakes

name: Monstera Deliciosa
description: Large, split leaves (fenestrations); loves bright, indirect light and humidity.

care.light: Bright indirect light is best; avoid intense, direct sun
care.water: Weekly; water when the top 2 inches of soil are dry
care.temperature_and_humidity: 68-86°F; high humidity is crucial for best leaf splits
care.tips: Provide a moss pole for support as it climbs; leaves need regular cleaning

name: Chinese Evergreen
description: Colorful foliage; tolerates low light and is very forgiving.

care.light: Low to medium indirect; bright varieties need more light to maintain color
care.water: Weekly; keep soil evenly moist but not saturated
care.tips: Excellent air purification qualities; wipe leaves to keep them glossy

name: Bird’s Nest Fern
description: Wavy fronds; thrives in humidity and indirect light.

care.light: Medium indirect; avoids any direct sun
care.water: Keep soil moist; water around the outside, not into the 'nest' center
care.tips: Mist frequently or place on a pebble tray to increase surrounding humidity

name: Boston Fern
description: Feathery fronds; loves moisture and indirect light.

care.light: Indirect light; morning sun is acceptable
care.water: Keep soil moist at all times; never let it completely dry out
care.tips: Will drop leaves if air is too dry; regular misting is essential

name: Maidenhair Fern
description: Delicate, lacy leaves; needs consistent humidity and gentle care.

care.light: Indirect light; prefers lower light than other ferns
care.water: Keep soil moist constantly; drying out is fatal
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; requires high, stable humidity (e.g., in a terrarium)
care.tips: Consider placing it in a bathroom or kitchen for maximum humidity

name: Areca Palm
description: Graceful fronds; prefers bright light and regular watering.

care.light: Bright indirect light; avoids direct sun which can scorch fronds
care.water: Weekly; keep soil evenly moist, especially in summer
care.tips: Sensitive to chlorine and fluoride in tap water, which can cause brown tips

name: Parlor Palm
description: Compact palm; thrives in low light and adds elegance indoors.

care.light: Low to medium indirect; excellent low-light tolerance
care.water: Weekly; allow the top of the soil to dry slightly
care.tips: A great choice for beginners; repot infrequently as they prefer to be root-bound

name: Kentia Palm
description: Tall, arching fronds; slow-growing and tolerant of low light.

care.light: Medium to bright indirect; highly adaptable, tolerates lower light
care.water: Weekly; allow the top layer of soil to dry before watering
care.tips: Less prone to spider mites than other palms; slow growth makes it low maintenance

name: Ponytail Palm
description: Bulbous base with long, thin leaves; drought-tolerant and quirky.

care.light: Bright indirect; direct sunlight is tolerated well
care.water: Every 2-3 weeks; water deeply, then let soil dry out completely
care.tips: The swollen trunk stores water, so infrequent watering is key to its health

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
description: Large, violin-shaped leaves; loves bright light and consistent care.

care.light: Bright indirect; needs a substantial amount of light to thrive
care.water: Weekly; water thoroughly when the top 2 inches of soil are dry
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; sensitive to moving, drafts, and sudden changes
care.tips: Rotate weekly to ensure even growth; dust leaves regularly

name: Calathea
description: Colorful patterned leaves; folds up at night, loves humidity.

care.light: Medium indirect; avoids direct sun which will bleach the leaves
care.water: Keep soil moist; do not let it dry out completely
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; requires high humidity to prevent leaf crisping
care.tips: Use distilled water or rainwater to avoid mineral build-up and leaf damage

name: Prayer Plant
description: Striking red-veined leaves; thrives in indirect light and moisture.

care.light: Medium indirect; tolerates lower light than Calathea
care.water: Keep soil moist; ensure the topsoil doesn't completely dry out
care.tips: Leaves fold up at night, resembling praying hands (hence the nickname)

name: Croton
description: Bright, multicolored leaves; needs lots of light and warmth.

care.light: Bright direct sun for best color; will revert to green in low light
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist, but reduce slightly in winter
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-85°F; sensitive to cold drafts and low temps
care.tips: Leaf drop is a common sign of stress (too little light, water, or a move)

name: Dieffenbachia
description: Large, variegated leaves; prefers filtered light and moderate watering.

care.light: Medium indirect; brighter light encourages more variegation
care.water: Weekly; allow the top third of the soil to dry between waterings
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; keep warm and away from drafts
care.tips: All parts are toxic; handle with care and keep away from pets/children

name: Dragon Tree
description: Spiky, red-edged leaves; drought-tolerant and stylish.

care.light: Bright indirect; adapts to lower light but can become leggy
care.water: Every 2 weeks; let the top half of the soil dry out
care.tips: Tolerates some neglect; browning leaf tips are often caused by overwatering or chemicals in tap water

name: Corn Plant
description: Tall cane-like stems with green leaves; easy-care and adaptable.

care.light: Medium indirect; tolerates low light conditions well
care.water: Weekly; allow the topsoil to dry before watering again
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-75°F; highly adaptable to average room temperature
care.tips: Excellent at purifying indoor air; avoid overwatering in winter

name: Umbrella Plant
description: Glossy, umbrella-like leaves; loves bright light and moderate watering.

care.light: Bright indirect; accepts a few hours of direct morning sun
care.water: Weekly; allow soil to dry out between waterings
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-75°F; tolerates drier air better than many plants
care.tips: Can be pruned to maintain size and shape; a quick grower

name: Flamingo Flower
description: Heart-shaped leaves and red spathes; thrives in bright, indirect light.

care.light: Bright indirect; insufficient light will stop blooming
care.water: Weekly; keep soil lightly moist but not soggy
care.soil: Chunky, epiphytic mix (like orchid mix with potting soil)
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-85°F; high humidity is ideal for blooming
care.tips: The colorful 'flower' is actually a spathe (modified leaf), which lasts for weeks

name: Moth Orchid
description: Elegant blooms; needs bright light and careful watering.

care.light: Bright indirect; avoids direct, harsh sun
care.water: Every 7-10 days; soak the pot in water for 15 minutes, then drain completely
care.soil: Specialized orchid bark or moss mix (epiphytic)
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; a slight temperature drop at night can encourage reblooming
care.tips: Do not overwater; roots need excellent airflow

name: African Violet
description: Velvety leaves and colorful flowers; loves indirect light and humidity.

care.light: Medium indirect; a northern or eastern window is perfect
care.water: Weekly; water from the bottom (in a saucer) with room-temperature water
care.tips: Avoid getting water on the leaves, which can cause brown spots; feed regularly for best blooms

name: Begonia
description: Bold, patterned leaves; prefers bright, indirect light.

care.light: Bright indirect; lower light can dull the colors
care.water: Weekly; allow the topsoil to dry before watering again
care.tips: Gorgeous foliage plant; sensitive to overwatering which can cause root rot

name: Christmas Cactus
description: Segmented stems with seasonal blooms; needs moderate light and water.

care.light: Bright indirect; can tolerate some direct sun in winter
care.water: Weekly; water when the top inch of soil is dry
care.soil: Cactus mix or standard soil amended with perlite
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-75°F; a cool, dark period (50°F) in fall encourages winter blooms
care.tips: It's a tropical cactus, not a desert one; do not let it dry out completely

name: Easter Cactus
description: Similar to Christmas cactus but blooms in spring; easy-care.

care.light: Bright indirect; eastern window is ideal
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist during bloom time
care.soil: Cactus mix or standard soil amended with perlite
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-75°F; similar care to the Christmas Cactus
care.tips: Requires a shorter period of darkness and coolness in late winter to set buds

name: Jade Plant
description: Thick, oval leaves; loves bright light and minimal watering.

care.light: Bright direct sun; needs 4+ hours of sun for compact growth
care.water: Every 2-3 weeks; allow soil to dry completely
care.tips: Can grow into a small tree over time; heavy watering causes leaf drop

name: String of Pearls
description: Trailing succulent with bead-like leaves; needs bright light.

care.light: Bright direct sun; appreciates some afternoon shade
care.water: Every 2 weeks; water when the 'pearls' start to look slightly shriveled
care.tips: The top of the soil needs light to prevent stem rot; avoid splashing water on the leaves

name: String of Hearts
description: Delicate vines with heart-shaped leaves; thrives in bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; can handle some direct morning sun
care.water: Every 2 weeks; let soil dry completely, as it stores water in its rhizomes
care.tips: Leaves will look thin and curled when they need water

name: Hoya
description: Thick, waxy leaves and fragrant flowers; loves bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; needs bright light to bloom
care.water: Every 2 weeks; allow soil to dry completely between waterings
care.tips: Do not remove the bloom spur after flowering—new blooms form on the same spur

name: Kalanchoe
description: Succulent with colorful blooms; needs bright light and minimal water.

care.light: Bright direct sun; needs intense light to bloom
care.water: Every 2-3 weeks; let soil dry completely
care.temperature_and_humidity: 60-85°F; requires short daylight hours to set buds (like Christmas Cactus)
care.tips: Pinch off spent flowers to encourage reblooming

name: Peperomia
description: Compact plant with varied leaf shapes; easy-care and pet-friendly.

care.light: Medium indirect; avoids harsh direct sun
care.water: Weekly; allow the top layer of soil to dry before watering
care.tips: Prefers to be slightly root-bound; look for signs of overwatering (drooping/mushy leaves)

name: Fittonia
description: Brightly veined leaves; loves humidity and indirect light.

care.light: Low to medium indirect; avoids direct sun
care.water: Keep soil moist; the plant will dramatically collapse (faint) when thirsty
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; requires high humidity to prevent leaf edges from crisping
care.tips: Excellent for terrariums where humidity is naturally high

name: Tradescantia
description: Trailing plant with purple-green leaves; fast-growing and hardy.

care.light: Bright indirect; direct sun intensifies purple color but can scorch leaves
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist, but not soggy
care.tips: Pinch back new growth to encourage bushiness; easily rooted in water

name: Coleus
description: Vibrant foliage in many colors; prefers bright light and regular watering.

care.light: Bright indirect; intense light brings out the best color
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-75°F; usually grown as an annual, but can be overwintered indoors
care.tips: Pinch off flower spikes to keep the plant focused on foliage growth

name: Bromeliad
description: Tropical plant with colorful rosettes; thrives in bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; avoid direct midday sun
care.water: Weekly; keep the central 'cup' or tank filled with water (flush every few weeks)
care.soil: Epiphytic mix or very fast-draining potting mix
care.tips: The plant will die after blooming but produces offsets (pups) that can be replanted

name: Air Plants
description: No soil needed; absorbs moisture from air, loves bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; some morning or late afternoon sun is fine
care.water: Mist daily, or soak in room-temperature water for 20-60 minutes once a week
care.soil: None required; mount on driftwood, rock, or place in glass globes
care.tips: Always shake off excess water after soaking to prevent rot

name: Money Tree
description: Braided trunk with green leaves; symbolizes good luck and wealth.

care.light: Bright indirect; adapts to lower light but may lose lower leaves
care.water: Weekly; water deeply and allow soil to dry out almost completely
care.tips: The braided trunk is permanent; ensure the elastic or tie used for braiding is not restricting growth

name: Cast Iron Plant
description: Extremely hardy; tolerates low light and neglect.

care.light: Low to medium; prefers shade and is prone to burning in direct light
care.water: Every 2 weeks; very tolerant of dryness
care.tips: The perfect plant for dark corners or forgetful owners; slow growth means infrequent repotting

name: Oxalis
description: Purple clover-like leaves; folds at night, loves bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; insufficient light causes it to stretch
care.water: Weekly; water when the top layer of soil feels dry
care.tips: Enters dormancy period, during which watering should be stopped until new growth appears

name: Alocasia
description: Large, dramatic leaves; needs humidity and bright light.

care.light: Bright indirect; direct sun will burn the leaves
care.water: Weekly; keep soil consistently moist, but not soggy
care.soil: Chunky, porous aroid mix that drains quickly
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-80°F; high humidity is essential, misting or a humidifier is recommended
care.tips: May go dormant in winter if conditions are too dry or cold; do not panic if leaves die back

name: Elephant Ear Colocasia
description: Similar to Alocasia but prefers wetter soil; bold foliage.

care.light: Bright indirect to partial direct sun
care.water: Keep soil moist constantly; prefers more water than Alocasia
care.temperature_and_humidity: 70-85°F; a true tropical plant, sensitive to cold
care.tips: Grows from a tuber and is often kept outdoors in summer; feed regularly during the growing season

name: Fishbone Prayer Plant
description: Striped leaves; thrives in humidity and indirect light.

care.light: Medium indirect; avoids direct sun
care.water: Keep soil moist; do not let it dry out completely
care.tips: Related to Calathea and Maranta; sensitive to hard tap water

name: Rattlesnake Plant
description: Wavy, patterned leaves; loves humidity and indirect light.

care.light: Medium indirect; can tolerate lower light but colors will fade
care.water: Keep soil moist; use distilled water to prevent brown tips
care.tips: Leaves move slightly throughout the day and close up at night

name: Bird of Paradise
description: Large, tropical leaves; needs bright light and space to grow.

care.light: Bright direct sun; needs 4+ hours of sun for best chance of blooming
care.water: Weekly; allow the top 1-2 inches of soil to dry out between waterings
care.temperature_and_humidity: 65-80°F; tolerates drier air but needs stable warmth
care.tips: Leaf tearing is natural as the plant grows to allow light through; fertilize heavily in spring/summer
